intro: Heptapleurum agasthiyamalayanum, commonly known as the Nilgiri laurel, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are usually arranged oppositely on the stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in the understorey of tropical forests. It produces small, clustered white flowers followed by dark blue berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
